001package edu.pdx.cs.joy.whitlock;
002
003import org.junit.jupiter.api.Disabled;
004import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
005import org.junit.jupiter.api.function.Executable;
006
007import java.time.Instant;
008import java.time.LocalDateTime;
009import java.time.ZoneId;
010import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
011import java.time.format.FormatStyle;
012import java.util.ArrayList;
013
014import static org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat;
015import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.anyOf;
016import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.containsString;
017import static org.hamcrest.core.IsEqual.equalTo;
018import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertThrows;
019
020/**
021 * Unit tests for the Student class.  In addition to the JUnit annotations,
022 * they also make use of the <a href="http://hamcrest.org/JavaHamcrest/">hamcrest</a>
023 * matchers for more readable assertion statements.
024 */
025public class StudentTest
026{
027
028  @Test
029  void studentNamedPatIsNamedPat() {
030    String name = "Pat";
031    var pat = createStudentNamed(name);
032    assertThat(pat.getName(), equalTo(name));
033  }
034
035  @Test
036  void allStudentSayThisClassIsTooMuchWork() {
037    var student = createStudentNamed("ANYTHING");
038    assertThat(student.says(), equalTo("This class is too much work"));
039  }
040
041  private static Student createStudentNamed(String name) {
042    return new Student(name, new ArrayList<>(), 0.0, "Doesn't matter");
043  }
044
045  @Disabled
046  @Test
047  void daveStudent() {
048    ArrayList<String> classes = new ArrayList<>();
049    classes.add("Algorithms");
050    classes.add("Operation Systems");
051    classes.add("Java");
052    Student dave = new Student("Dave", classes, 3.64, "male");
053
054    String toString = "Dave has a GPA of 3.64 and is taking 3 classes: Algorithms, Operating Systems, and Java.  He says \"This class is too much work\".";
055    assertThat(dave.toString(), equalTo(toString));
056  }
057
058  @Test
059  void studentToStringContainsThisClassIsTooMuchWork() {
060    Student student = createStudentNamed("Student");
061    assertThat(student.toString(), containsString(" \"This class is too much work\"."));
062  }
063
064  @Test
065  void studentWithNameThatIsANumberThrowsIllegalArgumentException() {
066    IllegalArgumentException exception =
067      assertThrows(IllegalArgumentException.class, () -> createStudentNamed("123"));
068    assertThat(exception.getMessage(), equalTo("Name cannot be a number"));
069  }
070
071  @Test
072  void negativeGpaThrowsNegativeGpaException() {
073    // Adam male -3.64 Intro to Database
074
075    ArrayList<String> classes = new ArrayList<>();
076    classes.add("Intro to Database");
077
078    assertThrows(Student.NegativeGpaException.class, () -> {
079      new Student("Adam", classes, -3.64, "male");
080    });
081
082  }
083
084  @Test
085  void aboutDatesKoanUsingDateTimeFormatterToFormatDate() {
086    LocalDateTime date = LocalDateTime.ofInstant(Instant.ofEpochMilli(100010001000L), ZoneId.of("-07:00"));
087
088    // assert with and without non-breaking space to handle Java 17 and 21+
089
090    String shortFormat = DateTimeFormatter.ofLocalizedDateTime(FormatStyle.SHORT).format(date);
091    assertThat(shortFormat, anyOf(equalTo("3/3/73, 5:33\u202FAM"), equalTo("3/3/73, 5:33 AM")));
092
093    String mediumFormat = DateTimeFormatter.ofLocalizedDateTime(FormatStyle.MEDIUM).format(date);
094    assertThat(mediumFormat, anyOf(equalTo("Mar 3, 1973, 5:33:21\u202FAM"), equalTo("Mar 3, 1973, 5:33:21 AM")));
095  }
096
097}
